No. The correct spelling is "Bestämde". In Swedish, the letter "d" should not have a umlaut (two dots) over it. Therefore, the correct spelling would be "Bestämde", not "Bestämmde".

In Swedish, the verb "bestämma" means to determine or decide something. It can also mean to appoint someone to a position or role. For example, you could say "Jag bestämde att jag skulle gå på bio ikväll" which translates to "I decided that I was going to the movies tonight." Alternatively, you could use the phrase "Han har blivit beställd till jobbet" which means "He has been appointed to the job."

Abbonemang (noun) means subscription or membership fee in English. It is commonly used in Sweden for various types of subscriptions, such as gym memberships, magazine subscriptions, and streaming service subscriptions. The correct pronunciation is 'ah-bon-ehmpong'.

Some examples where you might use "abbonemang" in everyday conversations include:

1. Jag har köpt en abbonemang till Fitness24 för att träna fler gånger i månaden. (I bought a monthly pass to Fitness24 so I can work out more often.)
2. Mina föräldrar har ett abbonemang till National Geographic och de läser varje nummer från början till slut. (My parents have a subscription to National Geographic, and they read every issue cover to cover.)
3. Min syster har en abbonemang på Spotify så hon kan lyssna på musik hela tiden när hon är hemma. (My sister has a Spotify subscription so she can listen to music all the time when she's at home.)
